contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "obey what John has written in it" or "obey what they read in it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: obey what is written in it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated with an active verb. Alternate translation: "will wear white garments" or "I will give white clothes" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: will be clothed in white garments

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated with an active verb. Alternate translation: "which God sent out over all the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: sent out into all the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "For they slaughtered you" or "For people killed you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: For you were slaughtered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This kind of crown was a likeness of wreaths of olive branches or laurel leaves, probably hammered out in gold. Examples actually made of leaves were given to victorious athletes to wear on their heads. This can be translated with an active verb. Alternate translation: "he received a crown" or "God gave him a crown (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was given a crown

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated with an active verb. Alternate translation: "God gave permission to its rider" or "Its rider received person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: To its rider was given permission

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated with an active verb. Alternate translation: "This rider received a huge sword" or "God gave this rider a huge sword" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: This rider was given a huge sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated with an active verb. AT "those whom others had killed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who had been killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "just as a stormy wind shakes a fig tree and causes it to drop its unripe fruit" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: just as a fig tree drops its unripe fruit when shaken by a stormy wind

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated with an active verb. Alternate translation: "those whom God's angel marked" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who were sealed

contextId.occurrenceNote: They were each given one trumpet. This can be stated in active form. Possible meanings are 1) "God gave them seven trumpets" or 2) "the Lamb gave them seven trumpets" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: seven trumpets were given to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The angel threw the hail and fire mixed with blood down onto the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It was thrown down onto the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "it burned up a third of the earth, a third of the trees, and all the green grass" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a third of it was burned up, a third of the trees were burned up, and all the green grass was burned up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the angel threw something like a great mountain burning with fire" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: something like a great mountain burning with fire was thrown

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "because the three angels who have not yet sounded their trumpets are about to sound them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: because of the remaining trumpet ... angels

contextId.occurrenceNote: The text does not say who has bound the angels, but it implies that God told someone to bind them. This can be stated with an active form. Alternate translation: "the four angels whom God has commanded them to bind" or "the four angels whom God has commanded someone to bind" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the four angels who are bound

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated with an active form. Alternate translation: "The angel released the four angels who had been prepared for ... that year" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The four angels who had been prepared for ... that year, were released

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated with an active form. Alternate translation: "The four angels whom God had prepared" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The four angels who had been prepared

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those whom the plagues had not killed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who were not killed by these plagues

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will accomplish his mystery" or "God will complete his secret plan" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the mystery of God will be accomplished

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone gave me a reed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A reed was given to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for God to judge the dead" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for the dead to be judged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Then someone opened God's temple in heaven" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Then God's temple in heaven was opened

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I saw the ark of his covenant in his temple" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the ark of his covenant was seen within his temple

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "A great sign appeared in heaven" or "I, John, saw a great sign in heaven" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: A great sign appeared in heaven

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "A woman who was wearing the sun and had the moon under her feet" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: a woman clothed with the sun, and with the moon under her feet

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God quickly took her child to himself" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Her child was snatched away to God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God threw the great dragon ... and his angels out of heaven and sent them to the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The great dragon ... was thrown down to the earth, and his angels were thrown down with him

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the dragon realized that God had thrown him out of heaven and sent him to earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the dragon realized he had been thrown down to the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but its fatal wound healed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but its fatal wound was healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God gave the beast ... God permitted the beast" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The beast was given ... It was permitted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God gave authority to the beast" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: authority was given to it

contextId.occurrenceNote: This phrase clarifies who on the earth will worship the beast. It can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those whose names the Lamb did not write ... in The Book of Life" or "those whose names were not ... in the Book of Life" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: everyone whose name was not written ... in the Book of Life

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom the people slaughtered" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who had been slaughtered

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. The noun "captivity" can be stated with the verb "capture." Alternate translation: "If it is God's will for the enemy to capture a certain person" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-abstractnouns]])
contextId.glQuote: If anyone is to be taken into captivity

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If it is God's will for the enemy to kill a certain person with a sword" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If anyone is to be killed with the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the enemy will kill him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he will be killed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the one who had a lethal wound that healed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the one whose lethal wound had been healed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God permitted the beast from the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: It was permitted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "on whose foreheads the Lamb and his Father had written their names" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who had his name and his Father's name written on their foreheads

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be translated in active form. Alternate translation: "that God has poured full strength" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that has been poured undiluted

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "he harvested the earth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the earth was harvested

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "for these plagues will complete the wrath of God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: for with them the wrath of God will be completed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you have made everyone know about your righteous deeds" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: your righteous deeds have been revealed

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The extreme heat burned them badly" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the people were scorched by the terrible heat

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the Euphrates. Its water dried up" or "the Euphrates, and caused its water to dry up" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the Euphrates. Its water was dried up

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the place that people call" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the place that is called

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The earthquake split the great city" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The great city was split

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone had written on her forehead a name" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: On her forehead was written a name

contextId.occurrenceNote: The certainty of what will happen in the future is spoken of as if the beast were going to it. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: it will go on to destruction

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "those whose names God did not write" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those whose names have not been written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to one group of people. The words "called" and "chosen" can be expressed in active form. Alternate translation: "the called, chosen, and faithful ones" or "the ones whom God has called and chosen, who are faithful to him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the called ones, the chosen ones, and the faithful ones

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "until God fulfills what he said will happen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: until God's words are fulfilled

contextId.occurrenceNote: Not to be found stands for not existing. This figure of speech can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "vanished; you will never have them again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: vanished, never to be found again

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "that wore fine linen" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that was dressed in fine linen

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "adorned herself with gold" or "adorned themselves with gold" or "wore gold" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: was adorned with gold

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one in your city will ever again hear the sound that harpists, musicians, flute players, and trumpeters make" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The sound made by harpists, musicians, flute players, and trumpeters will not be heard anymore in you

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one will ever again hear in Babylon the happy voices of a bridegroom and a bride" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The voices of the bridegroom and the bride will not be heard in you anymore

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "you deceived the people of the nations with your magic spells" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: all the nations were deceived by your sorcery

contextId.occurrenceNote: Blood being found there means that the people there were guilty of killing people. Alternate translation: "Babylon is guilty of killing the prophets and believers and all the other people in the world who were killed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: In her the blood of prophets and saints was found, and the blood of all who have been killed on the earth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "who sat on the throne" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: who was seated on the throne

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can state this in active form. Alternate translation: "the people whom God invites" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who are invited

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can state this in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone has written a name on him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He has a name written

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can state this in an active form. Alternate translation: "Blood had covered his robe" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He wears a robe that was dipped in blood

contextId.occurrenceNote: You can state this in active form. "Word of God" here is a metonym for Jesus Christ. Alternate translation: "his name is called the Message of God" or "his name is also the Word of God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: his name is called the Word of God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone has written a name on his robe and thigh:" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: He has a name written on his robe and on his thigh:

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The rider on the white horse captured the beast and the false prophet" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The beast was captured and with him the false prophet

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God threw the beast and the false prophet alive" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The two of them were thrown alive

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "The rider of the horse killed the remainder of the beast's armies with the sword that extended from his mouth" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The rest of them were killed by the sword that came out of the mouth of the one who rode on the horse

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will command the angel to free him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he must be set free

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whom God had given authority to judge" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: judgment was given to them

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "whose heads others had cut off" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: those who had been beheaded

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will release Satan from his prison" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Satan will be released from his prison

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God threw the devil, who had deceived them, into" or "God's angel threw the devil, who had deceived them, into" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The devil, who deceived them, was thrown into

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "where he had also thrown the beast and the false prophet" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: where the beast and the false prophet were

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God will torment them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: They will be tormented

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone opened the books" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: the books were opened

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God judged the people who had died and now lived again" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The dead were judged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "by what he had recorded" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: from the things that were written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God judged the dead people" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: were judged

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "God threw Death and Hades" or "God's angel threw Death and Hades" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Death and Hades were thrown

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "If God's angel did not find a person's name" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: If anyone's name was not found written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "the angel threw him into the lake of fire" or "the angel threw him into the place where fire burns forever" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: he was thrown into the lake of fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone had written" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: were written

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone had built the wall with jasper and the city with pure gold" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Its wall was built of jasper and the city of pure gold

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "Someone adorned the foundations of the wall" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: The foundations of the wall were adorned

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "someone had made each of the gates from a single pearl" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: each of the gates was made from a single pearl

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "No one will shut the gates" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: Its gates will not be shut

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "but only those whose names the Lamb wrote in his Book of Life" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: but only those whose names are written in the Lamb's Book of Life

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "which I have written about in this book" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: that are written about in this book
